ygData.subject: Re: More Bots, More Death, More Destruction
ygData.msgSnippet: ... commander kit kat said blacknightmare while she and her followers stopped near the base I m ready to visit you -just tell me what have i to do in order

::Blacknightmare/mantys/wespa/6 bat probes::

"commander kit kat" said blacknightmare while she and her followers 
stopped near the base "I'm ready to visit you -just tell me what have 
i to do in order to have that honor?"

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::KitKat::
> 
> She got the transmission and smiled. "AH good, more troops." She 
> replied. "We'll send two transports over right away."
> 
> She called out to Drillbit and Diamond. "Go take two pods over and 
> get our new troops please."
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > ::Killfest/Scyther/EndBringer/Demise/Greven::
> > 
> > Killfest looks up, frowning as he sees a small speck aproach from 
> the 
> > horizon. THe speck grows, soon recognizable as a transport pod, 
> with 
> > four stasis pods attatched to it...
> > 
> > Killfest frowns, watching the pod land near him, release the four 
> > stasis pods, and fly off again. He walks toward the stasis pods, 
> > arming his wrist blasters as they begin to open.
> > 
> > An evil smile crosses Killfest's face as he sees his team, newly 
> > awakened, arise from the pods, walking to him.
> > 
> > "Welcome back," he says to them, the team nodding, "We seem to be 
> on 
> > a planet. According to my scanners, one with translife, Predacons 
> > among them."
> > 
> > The Predacons were killers and good warriors, perfectly suiting 
> > Killfest. He activates his comm, sending a transmission to the 
> > Council Base.
> > 
> > "Predacons, this is Commander Killfest," he says. He was, after 
> all, 
> > commander of a terrorist group, a much depleted one, but a deadly 
> > group none-the-less, "Me and my group are stranded on an island, 
> > perhaps you could send a transport pod to my location?"
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > > ::Killfest/Scyther/EndBringer/Demise/Greven/Crovax::
> > > 
> > > The sound of guns filled the air, accompanied by screaming bots 
> and 
> > > laughing terrorists. Killfest ducked under a shot, firing back 
at 
> > the 
> > > bot that had fired and killing him with a well placed shot 
> through 
> > > the spark. He looked around and saw burning buildings, dead 
> bodies, 
> > > and scattered metal pieces everywhere.
> > > 
> > > This was just a normal attack on a normal space colony, like so 
> > many 
> > > that he had led in the past. There was nothing different about 
> > it ... 
> > > except for the fact that it marked the day of his defeat.
> > > 
> > > Killfest was the leader of a fairly large group of terrorists. 
> They 
> > > traveled through the vastness of space, pilfering, sacking, and 
> > > razing many a peaceful colony, selling scrapp and weapons to 
> other 
> > > various terrorists. It was an easy life, especially when a 
group 
> > was 
> > > as equipped for fighting as Killfest's.
> > > 
> > > The terrorist leader jumped backwards as a bot's body flew past 
> > him. 
> > > He got a glance of it before it landed in the ruins of a 
> collapsed 
> > > building, seeing that it was missing its head. That was the 
work 
> of 
> > > Scyther, one of the bots in Killfest's group. Scyther was 
> > experienced 
> > > in undercover missions, possessing the ability to alter his 
robot 
> > > mode, changing his appearance completely and making him 
virtually 
> > > unrecognizable. That, along with cloaking, spark signature 
> masking, 
> > > and several other abilities, made him the perfect spy, and an 
> > > excellent assassin. Killfest glanced over to where the bot had 
> come 
> > > flying from, watching Scyther slash off the head of another 
bot. 
> > > 
> > > Scyther preferred disabling opponents through decapitation and 
> then 
> > > stabbing them cleanly through the spark instead of splattering 
> > their 
> > > guts everywhere. Killfest had always preferred to mutilate his 
> > > enemies, but it was a matter of personal preference.
> > > 
> > > Seeing a group of enemy bots banded together and firing, 
Killfest 
> > > stretched out his arms, pointing his fists at them. Two large 
> guns 
> > > emerged out of both his huge wrists, firing four blue beams at 
> the 
> > > ground near the bots. The beams hit the ground at precisely the 
> > same 
> > > spot, making a grenade-sized explosion that sent the bots 
flying 
> in 
> > > different directions.
> > > 
> > > A loud scream of rage came from behind him, followed by 
multiple 
> > > explosions. Killfest ducked as a mutilated bot flew over his 
> head. 
> > He 
> > > glanced up at it, actually able to see through it from the 
damage 
> > > done to its torso.
> > > 
> > > EndBringer, Killfest thought to himself as he fired a pair of 
> optic 
> > > lasers at a random enemy, blowing off its head. EndBringer was 
> > > another bot under Killfest's command. Unlike, Scyther, 
EndBringer 
> > had 
> > > no liking for a clean kill. Instead, he enjoyed mutilating his 
> > > opponent as much as possible, leaving the body in pieces, and 
> often 
> > > completely unrecognizable as an ex-transformer.
> > > 
> > > Killfest glanced behind him at the form of the half-insane bot, 
> > > seeing a few of the colony defenders ganging up on him. He 
> watched 
> > > with an evil smile on his face as one of the attackers jumped 
at 
> > > EndBringer, flying back as one of EndBringer's four tentacles 
> > > contacted with him, sending electricity through him.
> > > 
> > > Turning back to the battle yet again, a missile launcher 
flipped 
> > over 
> > > Killfest's shoulder as he saw a bot rushing at him. The bot 
> jumped, 
> > > but was blown to pieces by a missile before he ever hit 
Killfest. 
> > An 
> > > ear splitting scream flew across the battlefield, the terrorist 
> > > leader chuckling as he heard it.
> > > 
> > > Demise. Killfest glanced to his left, seeing the bot holding an 
> > enemy 
> > > in one of his huge clawed, arms, a cable connecting the held 
bot 
> to 
> > > Demise's mouth. That was Demise's own special attack. The chord 
> > that 
> > > he launched from his mouth latched on to the victim bot, 
hacking 
> > into 
> > > their neural circuitry and sending unbearable waves of pain 
> through 
> > > them. Other than that, Demise had very weak optic lasers as his 
> > only 
> > > other long-range weapon, his hands being too large and accuard 
to 
> > > hold anything else. Demise threw his now-twitching victim 
aside, 
> > > swiping his claws at another attacker. Behind Killfest, a bot 
ran 
> > up, 
> > > jumping at him.
> > > 
> > > Killfest roared as a pair of hands wrapped around his neck, the 
> bot 
> > > obviously attempting to tackle him to the ground from behind.
> > > 
> > > Killfest was much too large for that.
> > > 
> > > Reaching behind him and simply grabbing the bot's back, 
Killfest 
> > > swung the attacker over his shoulder, bringing up his knee and 
> > > slamming the bot onto it. Sickening cracks sounded from the 
bot's 
> > > torso, Killfest dropping him to the ground.
> > > 
> > > Killfest turned his head as another scream reaches his ears, 
> > quickly 
> > > turning into a wet-sounding gurgling. He chuckled, watching a 
> huge 
> > > bot drop the crushed body of another one of the defenders onto 
> the 
> > > ground. The defender's torso was crushed, his head and limbs 
> > sticking 
> > > out in strange angles. The huge bot was Greven, another member 
of 
> > > Killfest's team. It was usually Greven and EndBringer who 
caused 
> > most 
> > > of the gore on the battlefield, being the two most violent bots 
> on 
> > > the team. Greven grabbed another bot, smashing a fist through 
its 
> > > chest.
> > > 
> > > A shot hit the terrorist leader in the back, Killfest turning 
> > around 
> > > and frowning. He was seeing something that usually didn't 
happen 
> on 
> > > these raids. A colony defender was holding off a whole group of 
> > > terrorists, about five or six of them. The bot was fairly 
large, 
> > but 
> > > then the terrorists were trained killers..
> > > 
> > > The terrorist leader took a step forward as one of the 
terrorists 
> > > jumped forward at the bot, a large shot blowing the terrorist 
> back. 
> > > The bot jumped back from another terrorist, the large cannon 
that 
> > was 
> > > attached instead of his left arm smoking.
> > > 
> > > Growling, Killfest took off at a jog toward the bot, the other 
> > > terrorists around the defender making it impossible to aim. He 
> > > watched the bot jump up, his jetpack blazing. He fired a few 
blue 
> > > optic shots, but failed to hit. He growled louder as the 
defender 
> > > transformed into a tank and fell to the ground, crushing three 
of 
> > the 
> > > terrorists under his wheels.
> > > 
> > > That was enough. Reaching into a storage compartment, the 
> terrorist 
> > > armed an EMP rifle. Aiming it at the enemy bot, he fired three 
> > times.
> > > 
> > > Energy waves flickered over the tank's armor as all three of 
the 
> > EMP 
> > > shots hit him, disabling circuits as they contacted. Continuing 
> to 
> > > move for a few seconds, the bot finally stopped after running 
> over 
> > > the remains of another one of the colony defenders.
> > > 
> > > Killfest growled, looking at the tank and then glancing into 
the 
> > > distance, looking at the other side of the colony. He smiled, 
> > > watching a wave of destruction come toward his group. That was 
> > > Crovax, his second in command, leading the other half of 
> Killfest's 
> > > group through the other side of the colony.
> > > 
> > > A few hours later, the terrorists were gathered in a basement, 
> > > counting their gains and losses. The bot Killfest had stunned 
was 
> > > strapped to the table, now awake, swearing and yelling for them 
> to 
> > > let him go and fight him. He was too strong for metal bonds, so 
> > they 
> > > had to use energon ones.
> > > 
> > > Suddenly, the door blew in, a group of Maximals rushing in, 
> weapons 
> > > leveled at the chests of the terrorists.
> > > 
> > > "You're under arrest," one of them said, looking in disgust 
> > > Killfest, "Charged with murder. You can give us your weapons 
and 
> go 
> > > peacefully, or we can blast you to little pieces and take you 
> back 
> > to 
> > > Cybertron that way."
> > > 
> > > Killfest laughed, "Maximals are putting me under arrest? How 
> about 
> > we 
> > > use your pieces for scrap!"
> > > 
> > > The terrorist leader brought up his EMP rifle, firing a shot at 
> > > Kluster's chest. The Maximal ducked, firing back at Killfest. 
For 
> > the 
> > > next several seconds, the room was filled with gunfire, objects 
> > > exploding and bots screaming. Killfest spun around after 
ducking 
> a 
> > > shot, his eyes widening as he saw the colony defender's cannon 
> > aimed 
> > > at him. The table had obviously been shot during the battle. 
> > Without 
> > > time to respond, Killfest was hit by an explosion, the room 
going 
> > > black....
> > > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > > Now, a little while later, Killfest flies through space in a 
> prison 
> > > pod, remembering that battle. After it, the Maximals had taken 
> the 
> > > survivors of the group to trial, and sentenced most of them to 
> > death. 
> > > He could still remember the day that his own sentence was 
carried 
> > > out....
> > > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > > He and the others in his group that weren't sentenced to death 
> had 
> > > been marched out to the spaceports, a crowd gathering to watch. 
> > Their 
> > > sentence was to be put in a pod, and sent out on a charted 
route 
> > that 
> > > would pass no major sectors, to fly through the vacuum of space 
> > > forever.
> > > 
> > > The other members of his group that had escaped death were 
> Scyther, 
> > > EndBringer, Demise, and Greven. They were not any worse than 
the 
> > > others, in fact quite the opposite. Scyther didn't have any 
sort 
> of 
> > > record, as a bot like him was impossible to track. EndBringer, 
> > > Demise, and Greven were brushed off by the record keepers as 
> insane 
> > > homicidal bots, and Killfest himself was very careful to 
conceal 
> > his 
> > > tracks. Due to lack of evidence, the Maximals had been forced 
to 
> > let 
> > > them live.
> > > 
> > > The Maximal commander that had captured Killfest stood in the 
> > crowd, 
> > > watching, his team around him. The Maximal commander's name was 
> > > Kluster, and his team included Rex, Proto, Grimmler, and 
> recently, 
> > > Firearm, who was the bot that had caused Killfest's defeat.
> > > 
> > > Killfest and the other terrorists were put in stasis pods, and 
> then 
> > > launched out to space. The crowd began to disperse, but one bot 
> > > stayed hidden from view on the roof of a building, watching the 
> > pods 
> > > turn into small dots in the distance, the light of their 
escort's 
> > > engine disappearing from view.
> > > 
> > > This bot's name was Hunter. He was a bot whose desire to 
destroy 
> > > Killfest outmatched his desire to survive. Killfest had taken 
all 
> > > that was dear to Hunter on one raid on one colony, killing the 
> only 
> > > femm Hunter had ever loved. Hunter had been left alive by 
> accident, 
> > > and he had sworn to rid the world of the terror Killfest had 
> > caused. 
> > > His whole life had been dedicated to that since the moment he 
had 
> > > discovered who had led the attack on his colony.
> > > 
> > > Glancing down at the planned route of the pods, a document that 
> he 
> > > had 'borrowed' from the Maximal elders, he growls to himself. 
The 
> > > Maximals might see it fit to escort the pods to a few 
lightyears 
> > away 
> > > and then trust them to follow their course from there, but 
Hunter 
> > > didn't. He would follow Killfest's pod, and make sure that it 
> > didn't 
> > > waver from its track.
> > > 
> > > Hunter was a loyal Maximal, and only respect for Maximal law 
> > > prevented him for blowing Killfest's pod to smithereens as soon 
> as 
> > it 
> > > was out of scanning range from Cybertron. If the pod wavered at 
> all 
> > > from its course, though...
> > > 
> > > Hunter turned, walking back to his small ship and lifting off, 
> > > following the pods.
> > > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > > Flying through space in his pod that served as a prison, 
> Killfest's 
> > > thoughts dwell on that period in his life, his defeat. He 
> clenches 
> > > his fists in the pod, being able to stay conscious even through 
> all 
> > > the precautions. He had tracked his progress all the way from 
> > > Cybertron, and he knew where he was. 
> > > 
> > > He also knew what had happened to his crew. They had been sent 
> off 
> > > along with him, but as soon as the escort left the pods, a ship 
> had 
> > > come out of transwarp, and when it was gone, so were the other 
> > pods, 
> > > and Killfest had been left alone.
> > > 
> > > He'd had plenty of time to think. Playing over the final battle 
> > again 
> > > and again, the face of that your colony defender had become the 
> > > object of his hatred. To him, it meant defeat, weakness, 
> everything 
> > > that may have caused his downfall.
> > > 
> > > Killfest clenches his fists tighter as the pod comes across 
some 
> > > turbulence, being diverted from its path by a transwarp portal. 
> If 
> > > only he got to see that bot again...
